creditline: Gift of David Hirst in honor of Mr. Koichi Yanagi
description: mottled dark green and navy blue bowl with silver beaded overglaze throughout; conical shape, narrow at foot and wide at lip; short round foot; arrived with a cube-shaped natural wood lidded box with Japanese writing on top and inside of lid, blue/white patterned cloth tie, gray/blue square slubby silk wrap with red stamp on corner, and speckled white hand made paper cover for box
inscription: top and inside lid of box
markings: brushmark on bottom, black ink, Japanese writing
medium: Porcelain with blue and green underglazes and "silver mist" overglaze
text: Kondō Takahiro was born into a family of traditional blue-and-white porcelain artists. Takahiro, however, has not been stymied by the weight of his family's past accomplishments. While still working with porcelain and cobalt, he has established his own reputation by creating works that he coats with “silver mist,” a metallic amalgam of silver, gold, and platinum. In the final firing, this amalgam beads up on the surface, creating thousands of shiny droplets against the underlying color.
title: Silver mist bowl with blue pattern
